TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ModuleClient extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Contains methods that a module can use to send messages to and receive from the service and interact with module twins.

MemberSignature.Value: public uint OperationTimeoutInMilliseconds { get; set; }
.property instance unsigned int32 OperationTimeoutInMilliseconds
Public Property OperationTimeoutInMilliseconds As UInteger
member this.OperationTimeoutInMilliseconds : uint32 with get, set

Docs.summary: Stores the timeout used in the operation retries. Note that this value is ignored for operations where a cancellation token is provided. For example, SendEventAsync(Message) will use this timeout, but SendEventAsync(Message, CancellationToken) will not. The latter operation will only be canceled by the provided cancellation token.

.property instance string ProductInfo
Public Property ProductInfo As String
member this.ProductInfo : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Stores custom product information that will be appended to the user agent string that is sent to IoT hub.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendEventAsync (Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message message);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendEventAsync(class Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message message) cil managed
Public Function SendEventAsync (message As Message) As Task
member this.SendEventAsync : Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: The message.
Docs.summary: Sends an event to IoT hub.
Docs.remarks: In case of a transient issue, retrying the operation should work. In case of a non-transient issue, inspect the error details and take steps accordingly. Please note that the list of exceptions is not exhaustive.
Docs.exception: Thrown when a required parameter is null.

Thrown if the service does not respond to the request within the timeout specified for the operation. The timeout values are largely transport protocol specific. Check the corresponding transport settings to see if they can be configured. The operation timeout for the client can be set using .
Thrown if the client encounters a transient retryable exception.
Thrown if a socket error occurs.
Thrown if an error occurs when performing an operation on a WebSocket connection.
Thrown if an I/O error occurs.
Thrown if the MQTT transport layer closes unexpectedly.
Thrown if an error occurs when communicating with IoT hub service. If is set to true then it is a transient exception. If is set to false then it is a non-transient exception.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendEventAsync (Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message message, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendEventAsync(class Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message message, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Function SendEventAsync (message As Message, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task
member this.SendEventAsync : Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: The message.
A cancellation token to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Sends an event to IoT hub.
Docs.remarks: In case of a transient issue, retrying the operation should work. In case of a non-transient issue, inspect the error details and take steps accordingly. Please note that the list of exceptions is not exhaustive.
Docs.exception: Thrown when a required parameter is null.

Thrown if the service does not respond to the request before the expiration of the passed . If a cancellation token is not supplied to the operation call, a cancellation token with an expiration time of 4 minutes is used.
Thrown if the client encounters a transient retryable exception.
Thrown if a socket error occurs.
Thrown if an error occurs when performing an operation on a WebSocket connection.

Docs.param: The retry policy.
Docs.summary: Sets the retry policy used in the operation retries. The change will take effect after any in-progress operations.
Docs.remarks: The default is: new ExponentialBackoff(int.MaxValue, TimeSpan.FromMilliseconds(100), TimeSpan.FromSeconds(10), TimeSpan.FromMilliseconds(100));
